data.title: URecon: Reconstruct initial conditions of N-Body simulations
data.name: URecon
data.description: U-Net Architecture to reconstruct the initial conditions of N-Body simulations

evidence: "URecon is a simple UNET architecture implemented in TensorFlow that can be used to reconstruct the initial conditions of N-body simulations from late time (e.g. z=0) density fields."
"The weights trained on Quijote fiducial cosmology simulations, used for the results presented in 2305.07018 are provided."
Requirements list (numpy/scipy, tensorflow, etc.) with no mention of package managers or containers, implying use via cloning/source rather than a registry.
